pr_title: Use the same RowExpressionCompiler in CursorProcessorCompiler

timeline.message:
Use the same RowExpressionCompiler in CursorProcessorCompiler

In CursorProcessorCompiler, we created new RowExpressionCompiler when compiling
every expression. Now that RowExpressionCompiler is no longer stateless
(compiledLambdaMap needs to be updated), this becomes problematic. Conceptually,
RowExpressionCompiler is adding methods to a generated class, and all codegen
related to the same generated class should use the same RowExpressionCompiler.
Modify the code accordingly.

timeline.bodyText:
Before the change , looks like cursor is a parameter, while now it's a variable in the scope?
Parameter cursor = arg("cursor", RecordCursor.class);
timeline.author: wenleix

replies.bodyText: This logic is also copied from master. Essentially the passed in parameter is a method parameter. So getting it from the method's scope works as well as directly passing in the variable. I don't know why cursor was passed in but wasNull was fetched from scope. Seems like getting both from scope is more consistent.
replies.author: rongrong
